intro: Adenophora triphylla f. pilosissima, commonly known as the silky bluebell, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant features slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a soft, fuzzy texture. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This fern-like plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
